text: William Lockhart (1787 – 25 November 1856) was a British Conservative politician. Lockhart was elected Conservative MP for Lanarkshire at the 1841 general election and held the seat until his death in 1856. Alongside his role as MP, Lockhart was Dean of Faculties at Glasgow University from 1851 to 1853. Lockhart was the elder half-brother of writer and editor John Gibson Lockhart. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Category:UK MPs 1841–1847 Category:UK MPs 1847–1852 Category:UK MPs 1852–1857 Category:1787 births Category:1856 deaths
title: William Lockhart (MP)
